Key Match Events: Cooper Criswell retired the first 12 Tigers he faced, pitching four perfect innings.
Spencer Torkelson hit a go-ahead two-run homer off Rich Hill.
Riley Greene hit a two-run homer in the sixth inning.
Pre-Game Insights: Red Sox manager Alex Cora discussed the pitching strategy before the game, indicating a plan to use Rich Hill after Criswell.
Post-Match Reflections: Rich Hill took responsibility for the loss, stating he needed to make better pitches.
Alex Cora reflected on the team's struggles and emphasized the need to regroup and reassess.
Cooper Criswell expressed his support for Cora's decision, despite wanting to continue pitching.
